namespace.description: The MIRIAM compliant prefix of the identifier namespace. MUST be registered at https://identifiers.org/.
namespace.title: Namespace

identifier.description: The actual identifier within the namespace.
identifier.title: Identifier

Contributor.description: Data about a person who contributes to OpenTECR.

orcid.description: The ORCID is a nonproprietary alphanumeric code to uniquely identify authors and contributors of scholarly communication.
orcid.title: ORCID

Contributor.title: Contributor

rinchiKey.description: Hashed version of the reaction IUPAC international chemical identifier.
rinchiKey.title: RInChIKey

names.description: Common names or synonyms for this reaction mostly to further human understanding.
names.title: Common Names

stoichiometry.description: A dictionary of the stoichiometric coefficients and metabolitesthat define this reaction. Includes both reactants (negative coefficients) and products (positive coefficients).
stoichiometry.title: Stoichiometry

description: Define a curated measurement of thermodynamic information and context.

reference.description: The official source from which these measurements were curated. Ideally identified by a DOI.
reference.title: Literature Reference

curator.description: The person who contributed these measurements.
curator.title: Contributor

representative_reaction.description: The representative biochemical reaction to which the measurements apply.
representative_reaction.title: Representative Reaction

equilibriumConstant.description: The equilibrium constant ($K$) of this reaction.
equilibriumConstant.title: Equilibrium Constant

hydrogenPotential.description: The potential of hydrogen (pH) at which the measurements were performed.
hydrogenPotential.title: Potential of Hydrogen

magnesiumPotential.description: The potential of magnesium (pMg) at which the measurements were performed.
magnesiumPotential.title: Potential of Magnesium

temperature.description: The temperature in Kelvin (K) at which the measurements were performed.
temperature.title: Temperature

ionicStrength.description: The molar ionic strength ($I$) of the solution in which the reaction occurred.
ionicStrength.title: Ionic Strength

title: CuratedMeasurement
